title: Activate all automations & add PDF-specified services to the catalog

requirements.text: In AutomationDashboardPage.tsx, programmatically set all automation feature flags defined in automationConfig.ts to true (enabled) on page load if they are not already active, so that every automation toggle (WhatsApp auto-reply, proposal sending, lead follow-up, etc.) appears ON by default and persists to localStorage.
acceptanceCriteria: All automation toggles on the Automation Dashboard are in the ON/active state when the page is first visited.
The active automation count displayed on the dashboard reflects all automations being enabled.
The enabled states persist across page refreshes via localStorage.
No automation toggle is left in an OFF state by default.

requirements.text: Add the following new services to the seedServices.ts catalog based on the PDF document provided by the user. Until the exact PDF content is parsed, add the services as described: include service name, description, category, at least one package with a name and INR price, and set each service as active/visible. Services to add from the PDF should be appended to the existing seed services array without removing any existing entries.

quotes: add service according to given Pdf

acceptanceCriteria: All new services from the PDF are present in the seedServices.ts array.
Each new service has a unique ID, name, description, category, at least one package with an INR price, and isActive/isVisible set to true.
New services appear in the ServicesCatalogPage under the appropriate category filter.
New services appear in the ServiceManagementPage admin list.
Existing 35 services remain intact and unmodified.

constraints: Do not remove or deactivate any existing services or automations.
All new services must use INR pricing consistent with existing service data.
Do not modify immutable frontend files: useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts, main.tsx, or any file under frontend/src/components/ui.
nonGoals: Backend schema changes for services (services remain in seedServices.ts as static data).
Adding new automation types beyond those already defined in automationConfig.ts.
Changing the visual design or theme of any page.
